title: Boomers seek NZ bash
text:
Bitter cold may bring snow, sleet to Darling Downs 
final in favour of an exciting New Zealand escapade and, well, say sorry later. 
As a native Kiwi who was born and raised in Auckland, Roy shares insider knowledge of his homeland as only a local can. 
Now in his sixties he learnt first-hand how much fun you can have exploring New Zealand as he traced the footsteps of where the new tour will take its first guests. 
"I am not sure what I loved more, the Shotover River jet boats or flying up to remote peaks in a helicopter to sip wine and take in the view," he said. 
"The colours of the NZ landscape from the deep green dense tones to the light gold and lush lime greens are just spectacular. As is the food and those wonderful pinot noirs. 
"It's a pristine haven of incredible beaches and rolling hills offering fresh local produce. Photos View Photo Gallery 
"A must try are the bluff oysters when in season, local fish like whitebait and Hapuku, fresh olives, aged New Zealand beef and what better way to wash it down than with a glass of sauvignon blanc from one of the islands high quality vineyards. 
"Just heaven on middle-earth." 
Kim Portrate, Helloworld CMO said her group understood the expectations of the baby boomer generation were totally different to all that had preceded them. 
"It's why we have responded by creating exclusive travel experiences that satisfy their desire for a healthy, active lifestyle," she said. 

Silver Fox and Foxette's 10-day tour of New Zealand itinerary Day 1 Welcome to Auckland Day 2 Auckland
